Regulators around the region are leading the charge on responsible innovation and adoption of digital currencies like#USDC. Hear more from our team on the momentum and benefits of digital currency transformation in the APAC region.

This month we are proud to mark the 1-year anniversary of our first-of-a-kind partnership withStellar Development FoundationandUNHCR, the UN Refugee Agency, to deliver cash assistance to war-impacted and displaced persons in Ukraine via#USDC. 

Over the past year, recipients have been able to safely receive, spend and save digital cash assistance in the form of USDC into a wallet on their mobile device. 

The program, which is designed to be easy, allows recipients to conveniently convert this assistance to cash, withdrawing their funds in dollars, euros, or local currency via thousands of localMoneyGram Internationallocations, or to transfer the amount to a personal bank account. This support can then be used to cover basic needs like rent, food, medical care and heating during the winter.

Over the past couple of years, the Argentine peso has experienced more than 100% annual inflation, dramatically reducing the value of savings and purchasing power for everyday citizens.

Many Argentinian workers receive their paychecks in Argentine pesos. Converting those pesos to US dollars is a desirable way to retain the value of their hard-earned money, but it’s not feasible to open US dollar bank accounts because of government capital controls. 

That’s whereLemonand#USDCcome in. 👇

Lemon is an Argentina-based crypto exchange and digital wallet that operates in seven Latin American countries. They integrate traditional finance with crypto for their 2.2M users to empower them with better financial services.

By making a stable currency available to users and allowing them to easily spend it in their day-to-day lives, Lemon grew 200x in a period of just 2 years. Partnering with Circle to educate users about the benefits of USDC, Lemon saw USDC use double in the 3rd quarter of 2023 alone. 🔥

Read the full story to see how Lemon uses USDC:https://lnkd.in/g2bXmc4X

profile_overview: Circle helps businesses and developers harness the power of stablecoins for payments and internet commerce worldwide.
profile_bio:
Circle is a global financial technology firm that enables businesses of all sizes to harness the power of digital currencies and public blockchains for payments, commerce and financial applications worldwide.

Circle is also the principal operator of USDC, which has become the fastest growing, regulated and fully reserved dollar digital currency. USDC now stands at more than 45 billion and has supported about $1.4 trillion in transactions over the past year.

Today, Circle's transaction and treasury services are giving rise to a new generation of financial services and commerce applications that hold the promise of raising global economic prosperity through the frictionless exchange of financial value.

The Commissioner of Financial Regulation for the State of Maryland will accept all questions or complaints from Maryland residents regarding Circle Internet Financial, LLC (NMLS ID# 1201441) at 1100 North Eutaw Street, Suite 611, Baltimore, MD 21201, phone 1-888-784-0136. Circle's license status can be verified through the NMLS Consumer Access website at https://nmlsconsumeraccess.org.

Circle Internet Financial, LLC is licensed as a Money Transmitter by the New York State Department of Financial Institutions and to engage in Virtual Currency Business Activity by the New York State Department of Financial Services. https://www.circle.com/en/legal/licenses

We’re diving into our#OpenMoneyEra. 👀 

What is Open Money? 

Open money is a big idea, rooted in the open and interoperable design of the internet. Open money can empower almost anyone, anywhere in the world, to access and use dollars on the internet with speed and ease.

Open money unlocks global access to credit markets, banking, enterprise commerce, and financial aid relief that can be delivered nearly instantly, and nearly for free.

Open money is doing for money what the internet did for information: Making it move more economically, quickly, and seamlessly.

Latin America is embracing digital finance and the next internet era. See how 👇#DidYouKnow- From mid-2021 to mid-2022, citizens of LatAm countries received $562 billion in digital currency value. 

According to Mastercard, 51% of Latin American consumers have made a purchase with digital currency and one-third have used a stablecoin for everyday purchases. 

This explosive growth is largely fueled by a simple-yet-powerful value proposition — expanded access.

Latin America is primed to drive this shift globally because of: 
👉 Necessity: many populations within the region lack access to analog financial services
👉 Demographics: LatAm has a population of 658 million — roughly double the US. Nearly a quarter of this population is aged 14 or younger, giving LatAm another key advantage over other global regions with aging populations
👉 Developers: there are nearly a million developers in the region who are active in offshore development, much of which is outsourced by American companies
👉 Regulatory support: Fintech is also widely supported by policymakers, since it provides financial authorities with new tools to manage risks and compliance. LatAm fintech sector has recently doubled in size and now features approximately 2500 platforms

Taken together, Latin America’s well-established market demand, policy support and widespread dollar usage make the region a natural fit for broader stablecoin adoption. 

Read the full Executive Insights bySpencer SpinnellandRachel Mayerto learn more about our vision of internet-native financial infrastructure in LatAm.

This month we are proud to mark the 1-year anniversary of our first-of-a-kind partnership withStellar Development FoundationandUNHCR, the UN Refugee Agency, to deliver cash assistance to war-impacted and displaced persons in Ukraine via#USDC. 

Over the past year, recipients have been able to safely receive, spend and save digital cash assistance in the form of USDC into a wallet on their mobile device. 

The program, which is designed to be easy, allows recipients to conveniently convert this assistance to cash, withdrawing their funds in dollars, euros, or local currency via thousands of localMoneyGram Internationallocations, or to transfer the amount to a personal bank account. This support can then be used to cover basic needs like rent, food, medical care and heating during the winter.

Over the past couple of years, the Argentine peso has experienced more than 100% annual inflation, dramatically reducing the value of savings and purchasing power for everyday citizens.

Many Argentinian workers receive their paychecks in Argentine pesos. Converting those pesos to US dollars is a desirable way to retain the value of their hard-earned money, but it’s not feasible to open US dollar bank accounts because of government capital controls. 

That’s whereLemonand#USDCcome in. 👇

Lemon is an Argentina-based crypto exchange and digital wallet that operates in seven Latin American countries. They integrate traditional finance with crypto for their 2.2M users to empower them with better financial services.

By making a stable currency available to users and allowing them to easily spend it in their day-to-day lives, Lemon grew 200x in a period of just 2 years. Partnering with Circle to educate users about the benefits of USDC, Lemon saw USDC use double in the 3rd quarter of 2023 alone. 🔥

Read the full story to see how Lemon uses USDC:https://lnkd.in/g2bXmc4X
